sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Carter is being referred for further evaluation of persistent fatigue and intermittent joint pain of unclear etiology.

sections.heading: Clinical History
sections.content: The patient has experienced generalized fatigue for the past 3 months, accompanied by intermittent swelling and pain in the wrists and knees. There is no significant past medical history. No recent travel or known exposures. Over-the-counter analgesics provide only minimal relief.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: On examination, vital signs were stable. Mild tenderness and swelling were noted in both wrists. No erythema or warmth. No other abnormal findings.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Initial blood work revealed mild anemia (Hb 11.2 g/dL) and an elevated ESR (28 mm/hr). Renal and liver function tests were within normal limits. ANA screening pending.

sections.heading: Referral Request
sections.content: Please assess for possible autoimmune or rheumatological disorder and advise on further management.
